intro: Anaphyllum beddomei, commonly known as the beddome's anaphyllum, is a rare flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest undergrowth or rocky slopes. It is notable for its limited distribution and is considered a vulnerable species due to habitat loss and limited genetic diversity. Anaphyllum beddomei plays an important ecological role in its native ecosystem, supporting various pollinators and contributing to biodiversity.
